block.p: Sara Skidmore Krause, a medical student, and Dr. Souheil James Inati, a physicist, were married yesterday at the United Congregational Church in Little Compton, R.I. The Rev. Richard Manzelmann, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Inati, 25, is a second-year medical student at Dartmouth College in Hanover, N.H. Dr. Inati, 29, is an assistant research professor in Dartmouth's department of psychological and brain sciences and at its Center for Cognitive Neuroscience.

Sara Skidmore Krause, a medical student, and Dr. Souheil James Inati, a physicist, were married yesterday at the United Congregational Church in Little Compton, R.I. The Rev. Richard Manzelmann, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Inati, 25, is a second-year medical student at Dartmouth College in Hanover, N.H. Dr. Inati, 29, is an assistant research professor in Dartmouth's department of psychological and brain sciences and at its Center for Cognitive Neuroscience.

The bride graduated cum laude from Harvard University. She is a daughter of Cynthia T. Krause and Dr. William F. Krause of New Hartford, N.Y. Her father, a family physician, is a partner in Adirondack Community Physicians, a group practice, and the medical director of Hospice Care of Oneida County, both in New Hartford.

The bridegroom graduated from Yale and received a Ph.D. in physics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. His mother, Mona Najjar Inati of Sarasota, Fla., retired as a genetic counselor at the New England Medical Center in Boston. The bridegroom's father, the late Dr. Yakub C. Inati, was a pediatrician who practiced in Tripoli, Lebanon.
